snippet: White House officials said the president did not rule out the possibility of coming to Congress for a vote to support his actions, depending on what he decides to do.
abstract: President Obama and congressional leaders privately confront politically delicate question of whether Obama would be required to ask Congress for permission to take military action against Sunni fighters in Iraq; meeting does little to make clear whether the president has decided on a course of action in Iraq.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: White House officials said the president did not rule out the possibility of coming to Congress for a vote to support his actions, depending on what he decides to do.

headline.main: Obama and Lawmakers Meet to Discuss Iraq Action
headline.print_headline: Obama and Lawmakers Meet to Discuss Iraq Action
